required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of ZSP1603 in Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis （IPF）
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Phase Ib/IIa Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Tolerability, PK and Efficacy of ZSP1603 in Patients With Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: This study was divided into two parts. The first part was a dose escalation study: a open label dose escalation design was used to evaluate the safety, tolerance and pharmacokinetic characteristics of ZSP1603 in IPF patients. The second part was a randomized double-blind placebo-controlled design was used to preliminatively investigate the efficacy and safety of ZSP1603 in the treatment of IPF at the target dose.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The trial has two parts, a part 1 and a part 2, in part 1 will be unblinded

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: TEAEs will be summarized displaying the number of TEAEs along with the number and percentage of participants with at least one TEAE according to: Number of AEs, Severity and relation to study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in FVC From Baseline at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) evaluated from baseline until 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in FVC%Pred from baseline at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change of predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) (% Predicted) evaluated from baseline until 12 weeks of treatment.
